Anda Suka Politik? Hati-hati Jadi Target Pembobolan WhatsApp
03 Nov 2019, 12:09 by Fitraya Ramadhanny - detikInet


Foto: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

Jakarta - 1.400 Pengguna WhatsApp di dunia dibobol spyware Israel. Kalau punya minat politik, Anda adalah target!Facebook kini sedang memperkarakan NSO Group dari Israel karena dugaan menyebar spyware. NSO menyediakan spyware WhatsApp untuk kebutuhan pemerintah dan badan tertentu yang ingin memata-matai orang atau kelompok.Seperti dilihat detikcom, Minggu (3/10/2019) Forbes memberitakan laporan mengenai siapa yang dibobol oleh spyware ini berdasarkan data user Whatsapp. Ternyata setidaknya 100 korban adalah orang-orang yang berhubungan dengan politik."Pengacara, wartawan, aktivis HAM, pembangkang politik, diplomat, pejabat pemerintahan asing senior. Seseorang yang punya kepentingan terhadap kepolisian dan badan intelijen, juga akan jadi target," demikian diberitakan Forbes.Namun, laporan lain juga menyebutkan NSO menargetkan semua orang dari berbagai latar belakang. Jadi masyarakat umum juga harus waspada.Serangan spyware ini dimulai April sampai Mei 2019 dan baru terungkap sekarang. Spyware ini modusnya membuat panggilan telepon Whatsapp ke ponsel korban yang sudah diisi kode-kode tertentu.Pengguna hanya akan melihat panggilan telepon Whatsapp biasa. Namun di balik itu, ada kode yang terpasang ke telepon korban. Meskipun telepon itu tidak dijawab.

Do you like politics? Be Careful So Target WhatsApp Burglary
03 Nov 2019, 12:09 by Fitraya Ramadhanny - detikInet


Photo: Justin Sullivan / Getty Images

Jakarta - 1,400 WhatsApp users in the world have been hacked into Israeli spyware. If you have political interests, you are a target! Facebook is now suing the NSO Group from Israel for allegedly spreading spyware. NSO provides WhatsApp spyware for the needs of governments and certain agencies who want to spy on people or groups. As viewed detikcom, Sunday (10/10/2019) Forbes reports on who was hacked by spyware based on Whatsapp user data. It turns out that at least 100 victims are people who are related to politics. "Lawyers, journalists, human rights activists, political dissidents, diplomats, senior foreign government officials. Someone who has an interest in the police and intelligence services, will also be targeted," Forbes reported. However, other reports also mention the NSO is targeting everyone from various backgrounds. So the general public must also be vigilant. This spyware attack began from April to May 2019 and has only been revealed now. This spyware mode makes Whatsapp phone calls to the victim's cellphone that has been filled with certain codes. Users will only see ordinary Whatsapp phone calls. But behind that, there is a code attached to the victim's telephone. Even though the call was not answered.
